data.enText: a story from ancient times, especially one that was told to explain natural events or to describe the early history of a people; this type of story
a creation myth (= that explains how the world began)
the heroes of myth and legend

data.chText: 虚构的东西；荒诞的说法；不真实的事
data.enText: something that many people believe but that does not exist or is false

data.chText: 该消除那种无阶级社会的神话了。
data.enText: It is time to dispel the myth of a classless society (= to show that it does not exist) .

data.chText: 都说女人开车比男人差，其实不然。
data.enText: Contrary to popular myth , women are not worse drivers than men.

ex.chText: 这个东方传说很吸引人。
这个传说讲的是耶稣小时候的事情。
ex.enText: This legend is about Jesus' childhood.

synonyms.bx: 常指有关名人、勇士、历险、奇异事件等的古老传说。

ex.chText: 希腊人有许多神话故事。
意大利文化充满古代神话。
ex.enText: Italian culture is full of ancient myths.

synonyms.bx: 尤指为解释自然或历史事件而编造的古老故事。

ex.chText: 一篇关于巨人的北欧萨迦
戴尔的传奇故事非常出名。
ex.enText: The Dell saga is well known.

ex.chText: 他写了一篇关于俄克拉荷马州一家地方银行兴衰的精彩传奇故事。
ex.enText: He wrote a brilliant saga of the rise and collapse of a bank in Oklahoma.

synonyms.bx: 原指有关北欧海盗的传说，现多指各类传奇故事。

tr: a traditional story accepted as history
serves to explain the world view of a people

value.def: A myth is a well-known story which was made up in the past to explain natural events or to justify religious beliefs or social customs.

example.ex: There is a famous Greek myth in which Icarus flew too near to the Sun.
example.tran: 有一个著名的希腊神话，讲的是伊卡洛斯飞得离太阳过近的故事。

example.ex: ...the world of magic and of myth.

value.def: If you describe a belief or explanation as a myth, you mean that many people believe it but it is actually untrue.

example.ex: Contrary to the popular myth, women are not reckless spendthrifts.
example.tran: 和人们的普遍观念恰恰相反，女性并不是胡乱挥霍者。

value.tran: 错误的看法（或认识）；编造的话;谎言
